ReportText: DATE OF EXAM: 07/02/2019 EXAMINATION: Chest 2 Views CLINICAL INDICATION: Shortness of breath. COMPARISON: None. FINDINGS: There is a small densely calcified granuloma within the right upper lobe. The lungs otherwise appear unremarkable without superimposed acute pulmonary infiltrates. There are no pulmonary masses. There are no pleural effusions. There is no pneumothorax. The pulmonary vascularity appears unremarkable. The cardiomediastinum appears unremarkable. IMPRESSION: Negative Electronically signed by [[PERSONALNAME], M.D.
